text: objections at a later time.  Signing, sealing, and certification will be deemed waived.  These terms acceptable, counsel?
They are.
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Ms. Saimesier, could you please state your full name and current address, please.
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: My name is Sicilia Saimesier.  I live at 1330 West Spencer Street in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19141.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And were you employed prior to October 9th of 2018?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: I was working with Genesis.  Now I'm working with Abramson Center, and it's been ten years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So you were working for Abramson prior to October 9th of 2018?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Abramson.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was your job with Abramson?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: CNA.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What were your duties as a CNA?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Lift, push.  I did pulling as well.  Like, you have a device called a sling that you attach to machines so you can lift the patient.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So it involved lifting of patients?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Some patients you have to get a second person to help you lift them with both hands.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you injured on October 9, 2018?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how specifically were you injured?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Was it when I was pushing the person?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's what I'm asking.  How were you injured on October 9th?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: I was using a machine to lift the person, and I pulled the sling because the person was very heavy.  She could not bend her knee so you had to push the machine to help her move and that's how I hit my shoulder.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you injured your shoulder while lifting a patient?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where specifically in your shoulder?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: The right side and my neck.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you continue working after your injury?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: No.  I had another patient to work with and somebody else came and give me assistance.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you out of work for any period of time?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When was that?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: After the injury.  I don't remember exactly the date, but it was, like, three or four months.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Then you returned to work?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.  I returned to work, but since I was in a lot of pain the doctor restricted me to light-duty.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you still working light-duty now?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: No.  They sent me back to the floor and they still send me to very hard places.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When did you go back to working in that capacity?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: I don't remember exactly, but I believe it was in the month of May or something like that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you receive treatment for your injuries after October 9th of 2018?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.  And I'm still receiving treatment now.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Who have you received treatment from?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: I went to therapy and I was referred to Dr. Anand.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you seeing anyone else besides Dr. Anand?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: No.  I don't think so.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you also seeing Dr. McNodi?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What treatment is he providing for you?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: The treatment consist of patches that they put on my arm.  They give me acupuncture, and they want to give me needles too.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is this Dr. McNodi or Dr. Anand?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Dr. Anand.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long have you been treating with Dr. Anand?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: After the therapy sessions that were referred by my company, then I started doing therapy with Dr. Anand.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall if that --
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: I went to therapy to see Dr. Mark and Dr. Mark send me to Dr. Anand.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What body part is Dr. Anand treating you for?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: My arm, my shoulder.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you started telling us already, what treatment is he giving to you?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: He was going to give me injections.  He was going to do another nerve treatment, but I don't like the injection because it didn't help.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is he prescribing you any medications?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what are those for?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: For pain.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I believe you also said earlier that he's giving you acupuncture?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.  Acupuncture.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is the acupuncture helpful to you at all?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How so?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: When he does it, I don't feel a lot of pain.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how long does that relief last?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: A week.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does it affect your ability to function at all?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do the medications help you?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.  Some of them.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How so?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Some of them such as the tramadol, it keeps me from sleeping.  I cannot sleep.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you say it keeps you from sleeping?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: I feel sleepy, but I cannot sleep.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  You said some of the medications are helpful to you.  In what way are the medications helpful?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Some of them are useful because after work I can take them, and I don't feel the pain and that helps me get some sleep too.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you perform any chores at your house?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.  Because I don't have any children and, you know, children here in the U.S., they don't help at all.  But when I was first injured, I was not able to do any chores because I was in pain.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And are you able to do them now?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Now I can do them a little bit better.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there any specific ones that you could not do when you were first injured?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.  I could not even clean myself.  I could not take a shower.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you believe that you would be able to do these activities without Dr. Anand's treatment?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you working currently?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you believe you would be able to continue to work without Dr. Anand's treatment?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Would you like to continue treating with Dr. Anand?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How do you feel your pain level would be without his treatment?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: I would say without his treatment, it would be seven.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how is your pain as we sit here right now with his treatment?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: I would say five now.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Ma'am, I'm handing you a document.  This is a copy of our contingent fee agreement.
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Uh-uh.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you understand this document calls for us to represent you in this matter?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that your signature there at the bottom?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: This is an Act 109 Affidavit. Can you please confirm that the information in paragraphs one through five is correct.
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you've indicated in paragraph 6A that you have no outstanding child support liens against you, correct?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that your signature there at the bottom?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Counsel, I'm just going to move for the admission for those be admitted as Saimesier-1 and 2.  Do you have any objection?
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: No objection.
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: No other questions right now.
speaker: MR. MILEWSKI

text: (Whereupon, Saimesier-1 and Saimesier-2 were marked for identification.)
Ma'am, my name is Chris Davis. I'm going to ask you some questions.
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You worked full-time at the North Wales facility; is that correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In October of 2018, you injured your right shoulder moving a patient; is that true?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You went out of work for a period of time; is that correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you treated with a few different groups including Concentra Philadelphia; is that true?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: While at Concentra, they gave you physical therapy; is that correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then eventually you stopped treating with Concentra; is that correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: He offered you an injection, but you declined; is that true?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: He no longer treats you; is that correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Your current treatment is with a doctor by the name of Dr. Neil Anand; is that correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

text: Pantoprazole?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: I don't even know how to say that.  Show her this if she knows it.

text: Yeah.  And I have a lot of them.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

text: Soma?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: I have one actually right now.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You have a patch on your shoulder right now?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that the patch that's prescribed by Dr. Anand?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.

text: I wear it for 12 hours.  That's what I've been told.

text: All right.  So Dr. Anand prescribes all these medications for you in the beginning of March.  Do you still continue to take all of those medications or have you discontinued any of them?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: I still take them.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You still take them all?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you still take them at the same level as you did in March as we sit here today?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you haven't increased or decreased the medication in any way since March; is that fair?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No I'm wrong or no I'm correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: What you said is correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Now, you were out of work for several months due to your work injury; is that true?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Then you were released to go to work and then you went back to the Abramson Center working light-duty; is that correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: But they did not really give me light-duty.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you went back light-duty, were you working full-time, the same hours as you had before the work injury?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  And you continue to work for Abramson today; is that correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You continue to work full-time for Abramson as of today; is that fair?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you also said that you were switched from light-duty to full-duty or the light-duty was no longer -- strike that.  You said at some point you started working full-duty; is that true?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That was roughly May of 2019?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And so you've worked full-duty May, June, July, and August.  About four months now; is that correct?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  When your attorney was asking you questions, you talked about that some of the medications were helping you.  I assume that some of the medications were not helping you.  Do you remember that?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Which medications are not helping you in your opinion?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: The tramadol.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The tramadol?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any other one of them?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you continue to take the tramadol?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When was the last time that you took the tramadol?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: The last time I took it twice. It kept me from sleeping so I told the doctor the issue and I stopped taking it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember when that was?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: I believe July.  I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  July of 2019?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Has Dr. Anand sent you to any other doctors?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Sometimes they would refer me to Bensalem and also to the doctor over in Frankford.

text: Have you seen either of those doctors in the last three months?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Dr. Anand.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You said that Dr. Anand sent you to other doctors; is that true?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: They were going to do the same treatment so I didn't go.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So Dr. Anand referred you to other doctors, but you declined going.  Is that your testimony?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: I did not decline to go.  I don't know the place where it's located, and I cannot go by myself.  If that's the case, you can always come when the doctor is present to see the doctor.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  The treatment that Dr. Anand gives you, does it involve -- do you know what strapping is?
speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: It's not -- what they do for me is not strapping.  They tape the arm when I go see him.

speaker: MR. DAVIS

text: Not every time.

text: Yes.

text: How does it help you?

text: With pain feels better.  I feel better.

text: Yes.
